A tool to convert material indices in 3MF PrusaSlicer, OrcaSlicer (and maybe BambuSlicer) painted files.

I made the tool because I wanted to print some objects that used material indices 
greater than 5, on an Prusa XL. The XL does support re-mapping of filaments when starting a print,
but the UI only supports mapping the 5 first materials used in the gcode, so I needed a
way to map material indices above 5 down to below 5.

Example of remapping material 7 to 3 and material 6 to 2:
```shell
3mf-filament-remap --verbose remap --map=7:3,6:2 Train+Mini+Hogwarts.just-train.3mf remapped-colors.3mf
...
processing 3D/Objects/Hogwarts Express Waggon_559.model
  remapped 11 triangles
processing 3D/Objects/Hogwarts Express_525.model
  remapped 19116 triangles
processing Metadata/project_settings.config
processing Metadata/model_settings.config
  remapped 3 objects
...
```

---

Both Prusa and Bambu slicer encodes the painting the same way, but stores 
them in different attributes on the triangles in the model files:
- Prusa: mmu_segmentation
- Orca: paint_color

The encoding format is not documented, but was reverse engineered from the PrusaSlicer sources: 
[TriangleSelector::deserialize](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/blob/68c4bd671cddc20df1013c2181e640012de73b9c/src/libslic3r/TriangleSelector.cpp#L1872) and
[TriangleSelector::perform_split](https://github.com/prusa3d/PrusaSlicer/blob/68c4bd671cddc20df1013c2181e640012de73b9c/src/libslic3r/TriangleSelector.cpp#L1455).

To test and debug the decoding, the tool can also decode a "color segmentation" string into a svg.

Example:
```shell
go run . svg "" test.svg
```
Which results in:
![Decoded segmentation](./images/test.svg)
